description: Enterprise techniques used by Machete, ATT&CK group G0095 v1.0
name: Machete (G0095)

techniques.comment: [Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095) has has relied on users opening malicious links or attachments delivered through spearphishing to execute malware.
[Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095) has relied on TLS-encrypted FTP to transfer data out of target environments.
[Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095) had a module in its malware to find, encrypt, and upload files from fixed and removable drives.
[Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095) created their own directories to drop files into.
[Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095) used the startup folder for persistence.
[Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095) malware used FTP and Python’s urllib library to make HTTP requests to the C2 server.
[Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095) employed some visual obfuscation techniques by naming variables as combinations of letters to hinder analysis.
[Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095) used multiple compiled Python scripts on the victim’s system.
[Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095) has sent phishing emails that contain a link to an external server with ZIP and RAR archives.
[Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095) has delivered spearphishing emails that contain a zipped file with malicious contents.
